ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: I imagine they really hate the new Play Nice rules then.  Sounds like just the band of idiots the rules were made for. Explains why I have never heard from
ygData.messageBody:
I imagine they really hate the new 'Play Nice' rules then. Sounds like just
the band of idiots the rules were made for.

Explains why I have never heard from them. Causual gamers like me are
undoubtedly beneath the notice of even their lowest ranking feebs. Besides,
being 'purple' is probably a capital offense in their guild.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 10, 2000 2:35 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)


Heh hard to believe you haven't heard of FoH ;) They're the most infamous
guild in the game ;)

They live on Veeshan. Fires of the Heavens. Very powerful Uber Guild.
They can kill both dragons and break fear or sky in about 8 hours. Rumor
has it that they now have the firepower to do 2 different planes at the same
time. They approach the game like a business. Members of the guild are
told what to camp and when. Told where to be and when to play. Pretty sick
in some ways. But they ARE very efficient.. Very militarily organized.

At any rate, they're probably the most powerful guild in the game. Everyone
on Veeshan hates them (but respects their abilities) because of their stuck
up superior "own the zone" attitudes.

At any rate, Elderan is a powergamer extraordinaire and had at least 3 other
people playing the character so they could keep it levelling 24/7 for the
past month or so.

Just typical of FoH I believe they have an "A" team that they're powering to
60 so they can explore skyfire and Veeshan's peak.

FoH's modus operandi is to be first at everything so they don't have to deal
with crowding :)

Kevin

From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>

Sent: Wednesday, May 10, 2000 4:25 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)


> FoH? Not familiar with them, but then again the people I associate with
are
> definitely on the 'game' end. Who or what is FoH?
>
> Kit
>
> That ranger is a character, not a player. About 5 people played it 24/7
to
> get it to 60 that fast. He's a member of FoH... need I say more?
>
> It's not a game... it's a business.
>
> At least to them.
>
> heh
>
> Kev
